intro: Artanthe swartziana, commonly known as the Swartz's artanthe, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting well to rocky soils and full sun exposure. Artanthe swartziana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
